Container.Name: nzbgetvpn
Container.Overview: Docker container which runs the NZBGet while connecting to WireGuard or OpenVPN with iptables killswitch to prevent IP leakage when the tunnel goes down.

Config.Name: VPN_ENABLED
Config.Description: Enable VPN? yes/no

Config.Name: VPN_TYPE
Config.Description: openvpn / wireguard?

Config.Name: VPN_USERNAME
Config.Description: Username used to authenticate to the VPN (OpenVPN only)

Config.Name: VPN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password used to authenticate to the VPN (OpenVPN only)

Config.Name: LAN_NETWORK
Config.Description: Your local network address in CIDR notation

Config.Name: ENABLE_SSL
Config.Description: Let the container handle SSL (yes/no)?

Config.Name: WEBUI_USERNAME
Config.Description: Username used to connect to the WebUI

Config.Name: WEBUI_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password used to connect to the WebUI

Config.Name: Downloads Path
Config.Description: Path for /downloads

Config.Name: WEBUI_PORT_HTTP
Config.Description: Port used to access NZBGet (HTTP) remotely

Config.Name: WEBUI_PORT_HTTPS
Config.Description: Port used to access NZBGet (HTTPS) remotely

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: The UID applied to the /config and /downloads

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: The GID applied to the /config and /downloads

Config.Name: NAME_SERVERS
Config.Description: DNS used by the container

Config.Name: UMASK
Config.Description: umask used by the container

Config.Name: HEALTH_CHECK_HOST
Config.Description: Host used to check if connection is up

Config.Name: HEALTH_CHECK_INTERVAL
Config.Description: Interval in seconds between connection check

Config.Name: HEALTH_CHECK_SILENT
Config.Description: 1 supresses the 'Network is up' message

Config.Name: ADDITIONAL_PORTS
Config.Description: Additional ports for routing other containers through this one

Config.Name: config
Config.Description: config path of nzbgetvpn

Container.Description: Docker container which runs the NZBGet while connecting to WireGuard or OpenVPN with iptables killswitch to prevent IP leakage when the tunnel goes down.
